content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Students are given a device with a plunger on one end, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. When the plunger is pushed inwards a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>, as shown in Figure 2, the device exerts a restoring force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub D equals b times x to the n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is an unknown constant, and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math> is an unknown integer. (a) Describe an experimental procedure to collect data that would allow the students to determine the values of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math>. Include any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.

frqParts.text: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Students are given a device with a plunger on one end, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. When the plunger is pushed inwards a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>, as shown in Figure 2, the device exerts a restoring force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub D equals b times x to the n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is an unknown constant, and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math> is an unknown integer. (a) Describe an experimental procedure to collect data that would allow the students to determine the values of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math>. Include any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.

(b) The students are required to use a linear graph to determine the values of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math>.i. Identify two quantities the students could graph to produce a straight line that could be used to determine the values of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math>.Quantity plotted on vertical axis:__________Quantity plotted on horizontal axis:__________

ii. Describe how the properties of the graph described in part (b)(i) can be used to determine the values of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math>.

(c) In a later experiment, the students are given a nonideal spring that exerts a restoring force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub S equals k times x to the one half power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> is an unknown constant and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is the distance the spring is stretched from its equilibrium length. The studentsâ€™ measurements of <math alttext="F sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> are shown in the following table.<math alttext="F sub S, in newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math><math alttext="X, in meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math><math alttext="6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math><math alttext="0.021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.021</mn></math><math alttext="8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math><math alttext="0.034" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.034</mn></math><math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math><math alttext="0.053" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.053</mn></math><math alttext="12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn></math><math alttext="0.075" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.075</mn></math><math alttext="14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>14</mn></math><math alttext="0.092" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.092</mn></math><math alttext="16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn></math><math alttext="0.123" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.123</mn></math>i. Indicate two quantities that could be graphed to produce a straight line that could be used to calculate a numerical value for <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. Use the blank columns in the table to list any calculated quantities you will graph other than the data provided.Vertical Axis:_____Horizontal Axis:_____
ii. Plot the data points for the quantities indicated in part (c)(i) on the following graph. Clearly scale and label all axes, including units.
iii. Draw a straight line that best represents the data.
(d) Using the straight line from part (c)(iii), calculate the value of <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>.

skill.text: 1.B: Create quantitative graphs with appropriate scales and units, including plotting data.
